subject: Vam (Pro) Haptic Feedback support with third party prodcuts
description_text:
Hey,
I wanted to aks if the Product "Simsonn VAM Pro Linear Motor" with the
"Simsonn Plus X Pedal Control Box" is compatible with the Moza R5 Wheelbase
and SR-P Lite Pedals. So if i Want to use your products can they run
independently, without having any Simsonn Pedals? Do I have to connect the
Moza Pedals with the control Unit or do the motors and the control unit
work with the correct feedback without connecting pedals to the control
unit?

Sincerely,

M.K

conversations.body_text: Hi Mikolaj Kadluczka,    Yes, they are compatible. All you need is a new Plus X control box.  But mounting brackets may not be compatible.

If I understand it correctly, I need the motors a power Supply and ONE
Control Unit? The Moza Pedal connection stays in the wheelbase and I only
connect the VAM Motors to the Control Unit and plug it into the PC? How
does the feedback work, do the motors get the feedback from the game or
directly from the connected pedals?  If I want to buy the VAM Pro Motors,
do they work with the Plus X Control Unit or only with the Pro X Ultra
Control Unit.
Which Software do I use to calibrate the Motors, Simsonn Software or would
be Simhub better for Standalone Use (Without any other Simsonn
Peripherals)? Do they need Game support or does it work regardless of the
Game?
The mounting is my smallest concern, today you can easily 3D-print such
thing.
My last question regards the differences between the VAM Motors and the VAM
Pro? What is the difference between these two motors?
